name: Network States x Technology (Afropolitics)
description: three main points being made in this video. The speaker is discussing the concept of an Afro-Politan network state and why it is important. They talk about how social networks can be used for collective action, using the example of the N-SARS movement in Nigeria. They also discuss the potential of the African continent and how it is not being fully realized due to lack of coordination and governance. The speaker also highlights the importance of connecting with the African diaspora, which is sending $70 billion back to Africa each year, and leveraging their economic power. They encourage questions and comments throughout the presentation.
